segments.text: I'm starting to get quite frustrated looking at this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sheer obliviousness of the woman is infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the water soaking her foot and flooding the kitchen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just pouring out onto the floor, ruining the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children are about to have a nasty fall from that rickety stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of the boy crashing down onto a wet, slippery floor makes me cringe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to stop this before a serious accident occurs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The entire situation is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the crash and the cries already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This lack of attention to surroundings is truly unacceptable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a prime example of negligence leading to peril.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mess will be considerable, and someone will certainly get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself shaking my head at the entire spectacle.
segments.speaker: PAR
